title: Ras el Hanout

preparations.content: Place all ingredients in mixing bowl then, without measuring cup, toast <b>7 min/120°C/speed <b>.
With measuring cup in place, grind <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>.
Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula then grind again <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer ras el hanout to a sterilised glass jar (see tip). Store in a dark place and use as needed.

hintsAndTricks: Ras el hanout is a spice blend that originated in the Maghreb and combines many different ingredients. The composition differs regionally and from shop to shop. Usually around <b>25 different<b> spices are used.
The ratio of ingredients can be varied slightly according to taste.
Star anise, galangal, black cumin, bay or fennel are often added to the spice mixture.
A good ras el hanout is made with dried rose petals or buds.

To sterilise glass jar, preheat oven to 120°C. Thoroughly wash jar and lid in hot soapy water. Rinse by pouring boiling water over them, then place on a baking tray and heat for approx. <b>20 minutes<b> (120°C) until required.
In a clean glass jar, stored in a dry place, the spice mixture will keep for an almost unlimited time. However, since long storage affects the aroma, it should be used within <b>1 year.<b>
